main.name: Ignacio Gatti
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: Currently, I am doing my Phd studies on Computer Science. In a few words, I am working with Recommender Systems techniques, applying them to art domain.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: I am curious Python developer that love to merge software with other areas.

education.description: Thesis title: An assistant for working team selection based on SAT techniques

work.company: ISISTAN Institute Research - Politecnico di Milano
work.title: MoMA Dataset
work.description: Developed a crawler to extract images from MoMA web page. The objective was to create a dataset that can be useful to develop an artistic DNN.

work.title: Artwork curator System
work.description: Lead the devolpment and reseacrh of a novel Artwork Recommender System, using Deep Learning techniques. The idea is to find interesting relationships between artworks. The project is developed in Python. We use Autoencoder techniques (Denoising and Sliced-Wasserstein) to represent artworks images (obtaining a low-dimension representation) . Developed with Keras and Tensorflow. Also, we add an influence graph to connect authors. This graph was extracted from DBpedia Ontology and modeled using Networkx library. To compare vectors, we analyze different metrics, provided by Sklearn and Scipy. Nowadays, we have an API that is developed with Flask and Flask-Restplus and is deployed in Google App Engine

work.title: Cross-domain Recommender System
work.description: Developed a Cross-domain Recommender System approach to recommend books taking data from movie domain. The idea is to mitigate the cold-start problem in the book domain. The project is developed in Python. To model the items, we use word embedding techniques (Word2Vect and GLoVe). Developed with GenSim library. To link books and movies, we decided to generate an influence graph that connect authors. This graph was extracted from DBpedia Ontology and modeled using Networkx library. To compare vectors, we analyze different metrics, provided by Sklearn. Also, to store and manage the data, we use Pandas and MySql.
